head.title: Wagner Stott To Sell a Unit

hedline.hl1: Wagner Stott To Sell a Unit

block.p: Fidelity Capital Markets, the institutional brokerage trading arm of the Fidelity Investment Company, said today that it planned to acquire the Nasdaq trading division of Wagner Stott Mercator.
Terms of the deal were not disclosed.
Fidelity Capital Markets, the institutional brokerage trading arm of the Fidelity Investment Company, said today that it planned to acquire the Nasdaq trading division of Wagner Stott Mercator.
Terms of the deal were not disclosed.
At the close of business on Friday, Fidelity Capital will assume control of Wagner Stott's Nasdaq trading operations, including its 25 employees, equity positions and office space at 14 Wall Street.

Next Monday, Fidelity Capital will take buy and sell orders for all of the 950 Nasdaq-listed stocks currently being handled by Wagner Stott. Wagner Stott, a 71-year-old Wall Street securities firm, will keep its other brokerage operations.
Fidelity Investment, a unit of the FMR Corporation, is the nation's largest mutual fund company. .
